intro: Hoya buntokensis, commonly known as the Buntok hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements. Hoya buntokensis thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil. Its flowers, which typically bloom in shades of white and pink, emit a subtle fragrance, making it a popular choice among plant enthusiasts.
